questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the application layer in network communication?
options: To establish physical connections between devices
To provide the interface between applications and the underlying network
To encrypt all network traffic automatically
To assign IP addresses to network devices

questions.question: Which of the following protocols is responsible for translating domain names into IP addresses?
In a peer-to-peer network, what role can each connected device assume?
What are the three common message types used in HTTP?
Which protocol is specifically designed for sending email messages?
What happens to email messages on a server when retrieved using POP3?
options: They are copied to the client and remain on the server
They are moved to a different folder on the server
They are downloaded to the client and deleted from the server
They are encrypted and stored permanently on the server

questions.question: How does IMAP differ from POP3 in handling email?
options: IMAP downloads and deletes messages immediately
IMAP keeps original messages on the server until manually deleted
IMAP is only for sending email, not receiving

questions.question: What is the function of the presentation layer in the OSI model?
options: To establish and maintain sessions between applications
To route packets between different networks
To format, compress, and encrypt data for transmission
To define electrical specifications for physical connections

questions.question: Which DNS record type maps a domain name to an IPv4 address?
What is the purpose of DHCP in network communications?
options: To translate domain names to IP addresses
To dynamically assign IP addresses to network devices

questions.question: In the DHCP process, what message does a client send to initiate an IP address request?
What type of DNS record identifies mail servers for a domain?
Which protocol uses both port 20 and port 21 for different types of connections?
What is the primary advantage of using HTTPS over HTTP?
In a hybrid P2P system, what is the purpose of the index server?
options: To store all shared files centrally
To provide the location of resources stored on peers
To assign IP addresses to all peers

questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for creating and maintaining dialogs between applications?
What command-line utility allows manual querying of DNS servers?
Which protocol allows for long-term connections to shared resources, making them appear as local resources?
What is the default port number for HTTP communications?
Which email protocol allows users to keep messages on the server while working with copies locally?
What is the hierarchical structure used by DNS to organize domain names?
options: Tree-like structure with root at top

questions.question: In the context of FTP, what is the purpose of the control connection?
options: To transfer the actual file data
To manage commands and replies between client and server
To encrypt the file transfer process

questions.question: Which application layer protocol is used by web browsers to retrieve web pages?
What does a DHCP server provide to a client besides an IP address?
Which DNS record type is used for IPv6 addresses?
What is the main difference between client-server and peer-to-peer networks?
options: In P2P, devices can function as both client and server
Client-server is more expensive to implement

questions.question: Which protocol would be used to upload a file to a web server?
What happens when a DNS server cannot resolve a domain name using its own records?
options: It returns an error and stops
It contacts other DNS servers to resolve the name
It assigns a temporary IP address
It creates a new DNS record automatically

questions.question: Which TCP port does SMTP use for communication?
What is the purpose of the session layer in the OSI model?
options: To establish, maintain, and restart dialogs between applications
To route packets across network boundaries
To define physical connections between devices

questions.question: In FTP, which port is used for the actual data transfer?
What does the 'S' in HTTPS represent?
Which protocol is used by clients to retrieve email from a server without deleting it?
What is a fully qualified domain name (FQDN)?
options: An IP address with a subnet mask
A complete domain name specifying all domain levels

questions.question: Which application layer protocol dynamically assigns IP addresses?
What is the final step in the DHCP process?
Which message type in HTTP is used by a client to request data from a server?
What is the primary function of the application layer in the TCP/IP model?
Which protocol allows for the centralized management of shared files and printers?
What does DNS resolution accomplish?
options: Converts domain names to IP addresses
Assigns IP addresses to new devices

questions.question: In a P2P network, how are resources typically shared?
options: Through a hierarchical chain of servers
Via broadcast to all network devices

questions.question: Which email protocol is used specifically for sending messages?
What is the purpose of the GET method in HTTP?
options: To upload data to the server
To request data from the server
To delete resources on the server

questions.question: Which DNS record type identifies authoritative name servers for a domain?
What is a key characteristic of the peer-to-peer model?
options: Devices can function as both clients and servers
More expensive to implement than client-server

questions.question: Which protocol would you use to transfer large files between systems?
What information does a DHCP server provide to a client?
options: Domain name to IP address mapping
IP address, subnet mask, and default gateway

questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for data compression and encryption?
What is the default port for HTTPS?
Which protocol is used to retrieve email while keeping the original messages on the server?
